options.title: -a
options.description: Instead of showing only the title lines, show the complete manual pages, just like man(1) -a would. If the standard output is a terminal device and -c is not specified, use less(1) to paginate them. In -a mode, the options -IKOTW described in the mandoc(1) manual are also available.

options.title: -C file
options.description: Specify an alternative configuration file in man.conf(5) format.

options.title: -f
options.description: Search for all words in expression in manual page names only. The search is case-insensitive and matches whole words only. In this mode, macro keys, comparison operators, and logical operators are not available.

options.title: -k
options.description: Support the full expression syntax. It is the default for apropos.

options.title: -M path
options.description: Use the colon-separated path instead of the default list of paths searched for makewhatis(8) databases. Invalid paths, or paths without manual databases, are ignored.

options.title: -m path
options.description: Prepend the colon-separated paths to the list of paths searched for makewhatis(8) databases. Invalid paths, or paths without manual databases, are ignored.

options.title: -O outkey
options.description: Show the values associated with the key outkey instead of the manual descriptions.

options.title: -S arch
options.description: Restrict the search to pages for the specified machine(1) architecture. arch is case-insensitive. By default, pages for all architectures are shown.

options.title: -s section
options.description: Restrict the search to the specified section of the manual. By default, pages from all sections are shown. See man(1) for a listing of sections.

options.title: -i term
options.description: If term is a regular expression, it is evaluated case-insensitively. Has no effect on substring terms.
